pre-tool-use-rules.name: xcodebuild_command_constraint
pre-tool-use-rules.message: Make sure to use the `xcodebuild` skill to compile with xcodebuild.

pre-tool-use-rules.name: swift_build_test_command_constraint
pre-tool-use-rules.message: Make sure to use the `swift-package` skill to compile with `swift build`/`swift test`.

pre-tool-use-rules.name: xcodebuild_with_project
pre-tool-use-rules.message: Unless the project doesn't have a workspace, make sure to use the `-workspace` flag instead of `-project` when invoking xcodebuild.

versions.changes: Added pre-tool-use rule to warn about using -project instead of -workspace; improved skill/bash matching in common infrastructure
Added guidance to use xcrun simctl list to find valid simulator IDs instead of guessing
Added guidance to use -workspace instead of -project when workspace exists (xcodebuild and xcode-test skills)
Improved regex pattern for swift build/test detection using word boundaries instead of trailing whitespace
Split pre-tool-use rule into separate rules for xcodebuild and swift build/test, directing to appropriate skills
Add --executable flag to xcsift commands for displaying built executable path
Added configurable pre-tool-use rules with allow/deny/deny_once decisions and regex matching
Added single-line command constraint to xcodebuild and xcode-test skills for consistency
Version tracker now silently initializes on first run instead of showing entire version history
Fixed hooks path to use plugin-local common directory (plugins cannot reference external files)
Centralized hooks to common/hooks.json and made scripts self-configuring from plugin.json
Renamed from XcodeBuildSkills to XcodeBuildTools. Added version tracking with changelog notifications and session hooks.
Initial release with 8 Xcode development tools
